fields.description:
I was on the CodeHaus Jira instance and I decided to sign in to track the changes on a bug.

I registered and waited for the e-mail to arrive. Then I logged into the system, reached for the bug and pressed the "Watch it"  link.

The result was an error page with this error 
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericEntity.set] "sourceName" is not a field of UserAssociation

I'm going to attach the page to this issue
fields.summary: Error when trying to "watch" an issue

fields.description:
Hi 
We are using Jira 2.6 Enterprise against SQL Server Database now
We are using Jira extensively for our regular day to dat activities. 
To have a better control on the application and to generate more reports and doing a better management we have decided to migrate our backend to Oracle
We also have interest in moving to the latest version of Jira (3.3) and run this agains WebSphere
We need the following inputs from you

1. Any standaed procedure is there recomended by atlassian to carry out the migration. If not we have the following options
   a) Replicate the DB from SQL Server to Oracle(through the utilities supoported by  oracle and sql server). Install a new Jira 3.1.1 version and point this to the new instance. Jira should work fine from then
   b) Install new Jira 3.1.1 and import the backup XML onto Oracle
  
   We prerfer to do follow step a. Need your comments on this

2. once we do this then we will see how e can port this entire stuff to WebSphere
fields.summary: Jira- SQLServer to Oracle Migration

fields.description:
When clicking on 'Browse Project', the resulting screen should display the top level browse project view, rather than a single project's information. Find Issues allows you to to view issues relating to any project by default, but browse project displays info related just to the project you are in. Not much of a browse. 

Furthermore, on the current project detail page (that Browse Project currently defaults to) It is also not obvious that by clicking on the 'Projects' button that one will be taken to a top level view of all projects.

May also need to change the button to 'Browse Projects', rather than 'Browse Project'.
fields.summary: Browse Project page link to all projects should be clearer

fields.description: 2 users are allowed to attempt to edit an issue at the same time.  The last one who saves will overwrite any changes made by other users.  There should be a way to lock an issue while someone is trying to edit it to avoid this problem!
fields.summary: Users can clobber each other's changes

fields.description: Our JIRA system has been going down about once every 12 to 72 hours. When we look at $CATALINA_HOME/logs/catalina.out, there's no message from immediately prior to any of the crashes. This behavior has been happening since we upgraded from Tomcat 5.0 to Tomcat 5.5.
fields.summary: JIRA crashes, no errors in the log files

fields.description:
As we are located in germany, many users have names and email-account-names, which use the german Umlaut-characters ä, ü, ö, ß.

When a user edits an issue and a notification email gets generated, it is sent with the name of his account as the sending email-adress name. If this name contains one of those Umlaut-characters, these characters are missing.

example
correct would be: Gerd Güldenast
jira uses : Gerd Gldenast
fields.summary: Notifications don't work with international characters in senders name

fields.description: I have an e-mail address set up like foo@jira.com. If I send an e-mail to that address, the service with the createissuehandler kicks in and creates an issue in the correct project. But if the email is sent to Foo@jira.com it does not create an issue. I can't control 100% that people might not mix case in an e-mail address. Any suggestions to address this?
fields.summary: catchemail parameter appears to be case sensitive
Exception on filter Obhject

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6354].
  {panel}

In a corporate env, you want to be able to attach/display extra information about a user:
e.g Phone Number, Geographical Location, etc.

At the simplest level, they are what we (and I guess most corp users) would need.
However, to cater for different requirements, maybe you want to be able to add custom properties to a user.

Other Details:
You may want to mark whether these fields are required or optional
These fields must appear on the "Add New User" form.
You need to be able to map these fields to external user management.
fields.summary: Custom User Properties

fields.description:
Clone Issue operation should respect "Assign Issues" permission.

If the user is not granted this permission, the issue should be cloned without an assignee set.
fields.summary: Clone Issue operation should respect "Assign Issues" permission.

fields.description:
Vote count can become unsynchronized with actual vote list count if vote/unvote operation fails (for whatever reason) to update and store the vote count for the issue. A GenericEntityException exception should be thrown with the text "Unable to store issue".

Should be able to ensure synchronicity by checking vote count whenever voters list is retrieved.
fields.summary: Vote count can lose synchronicity with actual vote list count.

fields.description: The Non Quoted Comment Handler does a good job at stripping off quoted text represented by lines beginning with ">". However, Outlook doesn't use this form of quoting. Instead, perhaps this service should exit scanning the incoming email when the "-----Original Message-----" line is encountered?

fields.description:
zFrom what I can tell there are 4 different ways to 're-assign' an issue via the JIRA web interface:
1) select 'assign' this issue
2) select 'to me' (part of 'assign this issue (to me)' option
3) edit the issue and change the assignee
4) bulk edit the issue and alter the assignee

The third option fails to send an email notification to the previous 'assignee' saying that the issue has been re-assigned. Notifications to both the new 'assignee' and 'reporter' are sent.

The other options above all send notifications to all 3 parties - the previous 'assignee', the new 'assignee' and the 'reporter'. All users in question have their profile set to receive notifications of changes they make. In all four cases above the issue reporter made the change to the issue.

I believe this to be a bug.
fields.summary: Send to both previous and current assignees for all notifications

fields.description:
Currently when we create a new subtask, it has its own effort estimate which is independent of the parent task estimate. Yet in most (not all) cases a subtask should be implemented within the overall effort estimate of the parent task.

This is leading to a fair number of issues in terms of being able to figure out the deviations from estimates. In the scenario we use Jira, subtasks are simply detailed tasks of the parent task. Thus the estimate for the parent task is supposed to be inclusive of the time taken for itself (and all the subtasks).

The following options are possible options :

a. Do not allow estimation for subtask. Add up the logged work for the parent task and all the subtasks to reflect the total time spent on the parent task.
b. Add a field to the parent task (e.g. total time spent) which would include time logged against subtasks as well. Use this field in the Time Tracking Report (where perhaps only parent tasks could be shown)
c. Similar to "Log Work" screen which automatically reduces the "Pending Time" based on the amount of work logged (but also allows the existing value to be retained using a radio button), the creation of a subtask should allow for a reduction of the "Estimated effort" for the parent task (by default) and yet allow the such a reduction to not be made (using say a radio button).
fields.summary: Need to better manage the accuracy of estimates parent tasks (in situations where subtasks are created)

We have an installation of 3.0.3 we are testing the upgrade process to 3.1.1.  However, on the test installation, every time I try to import what we just exported from the old version, I get the following error:

Form Errors:
Exception occurred: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The element type "body" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</body>". 


I am going to make an educated guess, that this is being cause by the fact that somewhere in one of our 20,000 defects there is a description or comment that has a closing CDATA tag…  Which is messing up the parser on the import.

If this is the case, how can I find and fix this?  The backup file is nearly 70mb, so I can't open it in any visual parser that I know to see if I can find it.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6310].
  {panel}

In a previous issue management application we had a piece of functionality that we miss in Jira. Namely, the ability to send an issue notification email to one or more users. 

For example, if I want to get input on an issue from someone other than the reporter or assignee I have to either send them an email to them and reference the Jira issue, put the person on as a watcher, or assign the issue to the person. 

What would be preferrable would be the ability to send an inquiry / comment to a specific user such that the assignee does not change and that person does not now have to remove themselve from a watch.

Another motivation for this functionality is the use case where an assignee needs input from multiple other users. Currently in our organization, people tend to use assignment as a way of getting input to an issue. 

The problem with this approach is that it turns what could be a parallel process in to a serial process. For example, if I need to get input from three people and use assignment as the way of getting their input in to the issue the input requires assigning the issue 6 times along with the latency for each step.
fields.summary: Send notification / comment to specific user

fields.description:
It would be really handy if there were some way to refer to a search results with a URL. Often I do a search on behalf of a customer, and then wish to refer them to the results.

JIRA could do this by associating a token with each saved search, and then using this token to form a 'shortcut' URL.  For example, after clicking 'Save', the user gets redirected to a URL like http://jira.atlassian.com/search/Ax7Wbc.  This can then be cut & pasted into email.

fields.description:
We're trying to customize the jira workflow. Since we're using Oracle 9.x drivers and VARCHAR2(4000) for the workflow descriptor we must first apply this workaround (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Large+text+fields+in+Oracle). In doing this I...

1) Exported the current data from our production environment to an XML file.
2) Dropped the tables in our test environment.
3) Applied the changes to use CLOBs instead.
4) Switched to the 10g Oracle driver.

Once I did this I restarted Jira and observed that the tables were created properly with CLOBs for the descriptor column. Then I tried to import the data from our production environment. The first problem I ran into was "An invalid XML character (Unicode: 0x1c) was found in the CDATA section". I saw the atlassian-xml-cleaner mentioned in JRA-5206 and ran it on my XML import file. Now I'm getting...

Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataImport@b45130, result: null


I've attached a zip file that includes:

* jira-20050330-dirty.xml = The original data file that was exported from our production environment.
* jira-20050330-clean.xml = The jira-20050330-dirty.xml file after running it through the atlassian-xml-cleaner.
* catalina.out = The tomcat log showing the import of both the dirty and clean file.

I created a Jeely script to add comments to existing bugs in jira. When I run the script it adds all comments as expected. But after running once, it starts all over again from the beginning and adds all comments again. It does not seem to stop after the second run so I killed the jira server to stop it.

What is wrong here? And how can I now get rid of the duplicated comments? Could you pls provide me with a mysql delete statement which deletes all comments, which have the same timestamp/content???

fields.description:
Snipper from your doc: "When a CVS commit message mentions an issue, JIRA picks this up and displays the commit log in a tab in the mentioned issue".

Problem is, the following cvs commit message won't be parsed properly by Jira:

* 'Fixed JF-343, which was ....'
* 'JF-123: do not ...'

The issue key should be a token separated from any other token in the comment. Sometimes, the key is included in the CVS commit message and developers often forgot to "separate" it from the rest of the sentence.

This is working properly in Jira itself!? (that is, an issue is liked properly when referenced in a issue's comment).
fields.summary: CVS integration does not always find issue key in a CVS comment

Best Regards,
Ivan Rangelov

http://jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?...&assigneeSelect=specificgroup&assignee=XXXX&...&assigneeSelect=specificuser&assignee=YYY

http://jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?...&assigneeSelect=specificuser&assignee=YYY

String[] vals = request.getParameterValues("assignee");

fields.description:
When managing a Field Layout Scheme, the current screen is VERY laborious. Imagine a screen with 50 entries and you want to move the field on the bottom to the top. [Scroll Down. Click. Wait. Refresh.] repeat 50 times.

The View Scheme Issue Fields screen should be split in two:
* The first screen should be used to select which fields appear and what order they appear in; with two scrolling lists where the list on the left shows available fields, the list on the right shows selected fields, left/right arrows allow moving items between the available/selected lists, and up/down buttons allow modifiying the order on the selected list. Both lists should allow multi-select.
* The second screen shows only the selected fields, with Edit and Optional/Required links.

fields.description:
In the Filter panel of the Issue Navigator, you can only filter on "Affects Version" or "Fix for Version" IF you select a specific project.
However, the two alternatives "Any" and "No version" is common to all projects, and could easily be applied in a "global" search.

This would be a great improvement that helps to keep the home page less cluttered, because I could apply a filter that only selects issues that have no Fix for Version set. 

In my environment, I have issues that have nothing to do with development, like for instance when a network error made the night job crash, or when a client has moved and I need to change the FTP parameters for him.
And then there are the "regular" issues, bug fixes, improvements and other, that means there will be changes in the software.

With this new possibility, I will easily see those "stray" issues, and can focus on them. 
Issues that _do_ have a set Fix for version tend to be bundled, and so is the work with them. Therefore, it is not so important for me to see them on the dashboard.
fields.summary: Filter on: Fix for Any/No Fix version

fields.description:
As I already informed in issue JRA-6196, there's an error in the Filter Statistic portlet, and it is not fixed in 3.1.1 (despite this is what supposed to do, as you said in JRA-6196).

The description of the problem is the following:

If you create a filter using an specific field (status, for example), and then use the portlets Statistics or TwoDimensionalStatistic to show this filter using the same field you chose to create filter, the information the portlet shows is right, but when you click in one of the links (anyone of the statuses, in the example), it will show you not only that status, but ALL of them.

This is an example of the URI that fails:

/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&statusIds=1&statusIds=3&statusIds=10000&statusIds=10003&statusIds=10004&statusIds=10005&assigneeSelect=issue_current_user&statusIds=10005

As you can see, an "&statusIds=10005" is added at the end of the URL because of the status you clicked in, but it has no effect due to the other "statusIds" at the beggining of the URI (the ones which belongs to the filter itself, that in this case should be removed).

I hope to explain myself good enough, english is not my first tongue and is difficult to me to express things exactly.

Regards,

Andrés.

Trying to change the status a server error message is shown.
This behaviour was reported to three time in the last four weeks.

After re-viewing the causing issue the status change took part.
